section.title: SenseEntryTuple relation type
section.para: Represents a directed pair of a sense and an entry, such that the entry does not cotain the sense. This type is recommended to be used for situations when the entry is expected to be show to a human user as a subentry inside the sense of another entry.

listitem.para: Can be constrained and mapped to external authorities by the DMLex Controlled Vocabularies Module.

example.title: Example: encoding a subentry at subsense level
example.para: In this example, when the entry for safe is being shown to a human user, the entry for better safe than sorry is supposed to appear as a subentry at at the end of the first sense.
example.programlisting:
Entry[#safe]: headword="safe" Sense[#safe-sense-1]: indicator="protected from harm" Example: value="It isn't safe to park here." Sense[#safe-sense-2]: indicator="not likely to cause harm" Example: value="Is the ride safe for a small child?"
Entry[#bsts]: headword="better safe than sorry" Sense: definition="you should be careful even if it seems unnecessary"
SenseEntryTuple: caption: "subentry" superordinate="#safe-sense-1" subordinate="#bsts"

example.title: Example: encoding a subentry at sense level
example.para: In this example, when the entry for bible is being shown to the human user, the entry for the Bible is supposed to be appear there as a subentry, as if it were its first sense.
example.programlisting:
Entry[#the-bible]: headword="the Bible" Sense: "the book considered holy by Christians..."
Entry[#bible]: headword="bible" Sense[#bible-sense-1]: //empty sense, serves as a container for "the Bible" Sense[#bible-sense-2]: definition="a book considered important..."
SenseEntryTuple: caption="subentry" superordinate="#bible-sense-1" subordinate="#the-bible"
